text:
On a few occassions, Apache does not write errors to the error-log, while they 
are in the access-log. The errors that are logged in the error-log also show a 
time difference of up to 10 seconds with the access-log.
Latest version of Cronlog is used for log-file rotation. Machine is setup with 
a small number of virtual hosts, server activity is low/minimal.
creator: info@orangexl.com

text:
Do all of the symtpoms happen when Cronlog is out of the picture?

Note that there are some common "errors" which are not normally logged,
because they are expected situations and happen very frequently.
What is LogLevel set to?  What are the http response codes seen in 
access_log which don't seem to have a corresponding error_log entry?
creator: trawick@apache.org

text:
Sorry for not responding, was on a sabatical :-)

The problem does not seem to happen when cronolog is out of the picture. 
LogLevel is set to info, error were 401's and 404's.

I think the Apache2 documentation should not refer to cronolog UNTIL cronolog 
is compatible with Apache2 (see the cronolog homepage, which states that 
Apache2 compatibility is still work to be done)
creator: info@orangexl.com
slive@apache.org
text:
There have been various problems in piped logging fixed since this
was last updated.  If this problem still exists, please feel
free to reopen and provide more details.
